laboratory_examinations.findings: Visual acuity improved from 20/32 to 20/20 within 12 days after initiating treatment with SU5416.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement maintained with visual acuity reaching 20/16 after 4 weeks; returned to 20/32 over the next 6 months due to increasing vitreous floaters.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Visual field constricted circumferentially to within 8Â° of fixation initially, becoming normal after treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Normal visual field observed 5 months after therapy; no significant changes were recorded related to the optic nerve head hemangioblastoma over the follow-up period.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Contrast sensitivity improved in all but the lowest spatial frequency after treatment.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Most improvement noted in the mid spatial frequencies, with slight loss in sensitivity after 6 months; contrast sensitivity remained normal until the last follow-up.
